refnamediv.refpurpose: view an adjustment to the local clock

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: clockview reads a TAI64NA time adjustment. It then prints the local UNIX clock and the local UNIX clock plus that adjustment.
The adjustment must be a single 16-byte packet.
Both clocks are printed in ISO style (with nanoseconds and attoseconds), in the local time zone, using localtime3. Beware that many systems do not handle leap seconds correctly in localtime3.

refsection.title: History
refsection.para: clockview was originally part of DanielJ.Bernstein's clockspeed toolset in 1998.
